meanings.definition: The amount that a plate can hold.
meanings.sent1: At the party, guests enjoyed heaping platefuls of delicious food.
meanings.sent2: She always serves generous platefuls of pasta at her restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The picnic table groaned under the weight of the platefuls of sandwiches and fruit.
meanings.sent4: The buffet offered platefuls of options, tempting everyone with its variety.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread filled the room, promising platefuls of warmth and comfort.

meanings.definition: A serving of food that fills a plate.
meanings.sent1: The children happily devoured their platefuls of spaghetti and meatballs.
meanings.sent2: The chef carefully arranged colorful platefuls of sushi on the platter.
meanings.sent3: The cat eyed the platefuls of fish on the counter, planning its next move.
meanings.sent4: The garden party featured platefuls of treats, tempting even the pickiest eaters.
meanings.sent5: The bakery displayed platefuls of pastries, each one more tempting than the last.
